node.title: 'Can't be trusted in society': Janelle was gang raped at 16. She wants life-sentences for perpetrators
node.alt: A woman leaning against a table.
node.description: Janelle O'Connor was physically assaulted, raped and ordered to dig her own grave. She believes some people are beyond redemption and is lobbying for law reform. WARNING: This story contains descriptions of sexual and physical violence that may cause distress.
node.content:
["Janelle O'Connor has seen evil, and she thinks some people are beyond redemption.", "WARNING: This story contains descriptions of sexual and physical violence that may cause distress.", "Aged 16, she was physically assaulted, gang raped and ordered to dig her own grave after catching a lift to a party with a group of men \u2014\u00a0some of whom she knew.", "The Burnie schoolgirl only escaped the Christmas Eve attack alive because the ute she was travelling in crashed.", "The 1993 ordeal has had a lifelong impact.", "\"If you're going to rape and murder someone, you're giving these people a life sentence,\" Ms O'Connor said.", "Ms O'Connor was the first woman in Tasmania to tell the story of her sexual assault using her own name after joining the #LetHerSpeak campaign run by freelance journalist Nina Funnell.", "She has joined another law reform push \u2014\u00a0this time, a national campaign to have rapist-murderers locked up for life.", "\"Some people can't be rehabilitated, some perpetrators, murderers, have proven they can't be trusted in society,\" Ms O'Connor said.", "\"It's about time we started to protect vulnerable women.\"", "The campaign for law reform is being led by Eileen Culleton \u2014\u00a0the sister of Anne-Marie Culleton, who was raped and murdered by a stranger in her own bed in Darwin in 1988.", "The perpetrator, Jonathon Bakewell, was given a life sentence, but has after a law change been in and out of jail, despite breaching parole on six occasions.", "\"Victim families and the community need to know that when a rapist-murderer commits that crime, that they are behind bars for life, never to be released,\" Ms Culleton said.", "", "
Eileen Culleton's sister Anne-Marie Culleton was raped and murdered by a stranger in her own bed in 1988.(ABC News: Emma Rennie)
", "
Attorney-General vows to consider 'stronger action'
", "Ms Culleton met with Tasmanian Attorney-General Elise Archer in recent months alongside another powerful advocate for change, Tameka Ridgeway.", "Her rapist\u00a0Jamie John Curtis\u00a0was released on parole early this year after serving decades behind bars for the sexual assault of Ms Ridgeway and murder of her fiancee Dean Allie.", "The parole board noted Curtis had a personality disorder with \"a high number of psychopathic traits\" but was polite and respectful in his last six months of imprisonment.", "", "
Tasmania's Attorney-General Elise Archer says she'll consider taking advice from victim-survivors.(ABC News: Luke Bowden)
", "\"The cause that Eileen is fighting for is important because we need to protect the community,\" Ms Ridgeway said.", "\"The first time [Curtis]\u00a0was granted parole, it wasn't very long before he started offending again.", "\"The weeks coming up to him getting parole [this year], it wasn't just me who was suffering emotionally, it was his victims' family, his victims' friends.\"", "Ms Archer said the government's previous attempts at introducing mandatory sentencing had been \"blocked by Labor at every turn\".", "\"I have met with victim-survivors and I am currently seeking advice from my department on any further action that can be taken to ensure our sentencing laws reflect community expectations,\" she said.", "\"We have already acted in this area by passing the Dangerous Criminals and High Risk Offenders Act 2021 which allows for indefinite detention of dangerous criminals, and carefully-supervised release of high-risk offenders after their sentences end.\u00a0", "
Life sentence without parole 'unconscionable', lawyer says
", "Australian Lawyers Alliance national criminal justice spokesman Greg Barns said he was not supportive of the proposal.", "\"We don't support it because it takes away the discretion of the court to judge every case on its merits,\" Mr Barns said.", "He also said he believed it had \"zero deterrent effect\".", "\"People who commit rapes and murders don't think prior to committing those offences they better not do it because they might go to jail for life,\" he said.", "Ms Culleton urged Tasmanian MPs to listen to Ms O'Connor and Ms Ridgeway.", "\"I believe that we need to listen to every word that these women say, because Tameka and Janelle miraculously survived,\" she said.", "\"They can provide a unique insight that very few people can into just how evil and how brutal these offenders are.\""]
